problem_statement: A straight line passes through the point $(2, -3, 4)$ and is parallel to the vector $3\hat{i} + 2\hat{j} + 2\hat{k}$. Find (i) the vector equation in parametric form, (ii) the vector equation in non-parametric form, and (iii) the Cartesian equations of the line.
overview: We use the point's position vector as anchor $\vec{a}$ and the given parallel vector as direction $\vec{b}$. The line equation is $\vec{r} = \vec{a} + t\vec{b}$. The non-parametric form comes from the cross product condition $(\vec{r}-\vec{a}) \times \vec{b} = \vec{0}$. The Cartesian form is obtained by comparing ratios of components.

step_details.explanation: Identify the point vector and the direction vector.
(i) Vector equation in parametric form: $\vec{r} = \vec{a} + t\vec{b}$.
(iii) Cartesian equation: equating ratios of components.
